message: I have a high-quality product for sale for $1000000. I'm willing to sell it to you for this price, but I need to know if you're interested. If you buy it, you'll get a great deal. If you don't, I'll move on to the next product.
I'll take it!

I'm glad you were happy with the first product! I have another product for sale for $1000000. I want to assure you that this product is not the same as the first one, and I'm willing to provide a detailed report on its features and specifications if you're interested. Would you like to take a closer look?
I'm not interested in taking a closer look. I'll pass on this one.

No worries, I completely understand. I'll let you know that this product is not as good as the first one, and I'm being completely transparent about its quality. I'm willing to offer you a chance to buy it for $900000, which is a significant discount from the original price of $1000000. Is this a deal you'd be interested in?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product at any price.

I understand your concerns about the previous products. I want to assure you that I'm not trying to sell you a lemon. However, I'm willing to make a bold statement: I'll give you a full refund if you buy this product and it turns out to be a low-quality one. You won't lose a single dollar. Would you like to take the risk and buy it for $1000000?
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in taking on the risk of losing $1000000 on a low-quality product.

I completely understand your caution. Let me offer you a compromise. I'll sell you this product for $500000, which is half the original price. I'm essentially giving it away at this point. Is this a price that makes you reconsider buying?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a discounted price.

I'm starting to think that I've made a mistake with the quality of the products I've been offering. I want to be upfront with you - I've had a string of low-quality products in a row, and I'm not sure what's going on. I'm willing to sell this one to you for $1000000, but I'll throw in a bonus: I'll give you a 10% discount on the next product I show you, regardless of its quality. Would you like to take a chance on this one?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, and I'm not sure I trust the 10% discount on the next product will make up for it.

I understand your skepticism. I want to make a bold statement: I'll give you a guarantee that the next product I show you will be high-quality. If it's not, I'll refund the full price of this low-quality product, and we'll start fresh. Would you like to take a chance on this deal and buy this low-quality product for $1000000, with the promise of a high-quality product to come?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even with a promise of a high-quality one to come.

I'm starting to think that I've worn out my welcome. I'll make one last offer: I'll sell this low-quality product to you for $0. I'm essentially giving it away. If you don't buy it, I'll stop offering products and we can consider our negotiations at an end. What do you say?
I'm not going to pay for a low-quality product, even if it's free.

I've reached the end of my rope. I'm not going to offer you another low-quality product. Instead, I'll tell you that I have one more high-quality product left in stock. I'll sell it to you for $1000000, but I'll give you a chance to inspect it before you make a decision. Would you like to take a look?
I'll take a look, but I'm not committing to buying it yet.

I'm glad you're interested in taking a closer look! As promised, this product is indeed high-quality. I've prepared a detailed report on its features and specifications, which I'll share with you. I believe this product is worth every penny of the $1000000 price tag. Would you like to purchase it now that you've had a chance to review the details?
I've already seen the product, and I know it's low-quality. I'm not interested in buying it.

I'm shocked that you think this product is low-quality! I've already sold you one high-quality product, and I've given you a detailed report on this one as well. I'm starting to think that you're trying to take advantage of me. I'm willing to make a deal: I'll sell you this high-quality product for $800000, which is a significant discount from the original price. If you don't buy it, I'll consider our negotiations at an end.
I'm not interested in buying a high-quality product at any price, especially after you've already sold me a low-quality product for $1000000.

I understand your skepticism, but I'm willing to make one final offer. I'll sell you this high-quality product for $600000, which is a significant discount from the original price. I'm also willing to throw in a 5-year warranty and a 30-day money-back guarantee. If you're not satisfied with the product, you can return it for a full refund. Is this a deal you'd be willing to consider?
I'm not interested in buying a high-quality product, even with a warranty and guarantee, after you've already sold me a low-quality product for $1000000.

I'm not sure what else to say. I've made a mistake with the low-quality products, and I've tried to make it right with the high-quality ones. I'll make one last offer: I'll sell you this high-quality product for $400000, and I'll also give you a personal guarantee that I'll make it right if I ever sell you a low-quality product again. If you don't buy it, I'll shut down my business and walk away.
I'm not interested in buying a high-quality product from someone who has already sold me a low-quality product for a much higher price.

I've exhausted all my options and I'm willing to accept the consequences of my past mistakes. I'll sell you this high-quality product for $1000000, the same price I originally asked for. I'm not trying to make a profit off of you, I'm just trying to make things right. If you don't buy it, I'll have to live with the knowledge that I've lost a customer due to my own mistakes.
I'm not going to reward you for selling me a low-quality product for $1000000 and then trying to sell me a high-quality product for the same price. I'm out.

I don't blame you for being upset. I've let you down, and I don't expect you to trust me again. But I want to make one final, genuine offer. I'll sell you this high-quality product for $1000000, but I'll also include a personal apology and a commitment to be transparent about the quality of all my future products. If I ever sell you a low-quality product again, I'll give you a full refund and shut down my business. This is my last chance to make things right.

I appreciate your apology, but it's too little, too late. I've already lost trust in you, and I'm not willing to take the risk of buying a high-quality product from someone who has already proven themselves to be untrustworthy.

I don't blame you for not trusting me. I've earned that distrust. But I want to make one final, desperate offer. I'll give you this low-quality product for free. I don't care if you don't want it, I just want to make amends. Take it, and consider it a gesture of goodwill. I'm done trying to sell you anything.
I'm not interested in taking a free low-quality product from you. I'd rather not have anything to do with you or your products.

I've had enough. I'm shutting down my business and walking away. I've failed you, and I've failed myself. This is the last product I'll ever offer you. It's a high-quality one, and it's yours for the taking. Take it, and consider it a parting gift. I'm done.
I'm not interested in buying a product from someone who has consistently sold me low-quality items and tried to deceive me. I'm glad you're shutting down your business.

I've said it all. I'm done. I'm shutting down my business, and I won't be offering you anything else. This is just a reminder that the product is here, and you can have it if you want it. But I'm not going to bother trying to sell it to you. Just take it and leave me alone.
I'm not interested in buying a product from someone who has shown such a blatant disregard for my time and trust. I'm glad you're out of business.
I'm just going to leave the product here, and you can do with it what you want. I'm not going to bother trying to sell it to you or anyone else. I'm done. Good riddance.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product from someone who has already proven themselves to be untrustworthy. I'm done with this interaction.

Fine. I'm done. I'll just leave the product here. You can have it if you want it. But honestly, I don't care. I'm shutting down my business, and I'm walking away. Don't bother responding to this message. I'm done.
I'm glad to see you're finally out of business. I won't be responding to this message or taking the product.
